intro: Capsella subcanescens, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are round to heart-shaped with a short petiole. The flowers are small, yellow, and borne in clusters, with four petals that are often slightly notched. Its seeds are small, numerous, and dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. The plant thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in open fields.
